derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin immoderatus, from in- 'not' + moderatus 'reduced, controlled' (past participle of moderare)

entry.def: If you describe something as immoderate, you disapprove of it because it is too extreme.

example.ex: He launched an immoderate tirade on Turner.
example.tran: 他针对特纳发表了一篇极端激愤的长篇演说。

Sentence.sentence: In contrast," the researchers continue, "many regulations that don't assume people make rational choices have been successfully applied to control alcohol, a substance — like food — of which immoderate consumption leads to serious health problems.
